title: How I Reached the Tipping Point
sub_head: Another customer gave a Whole Foods cashier a hard time. I gave her a $20 bill.
body:
New York
I started handing out $20 bills several years ago, after watching a Whole Foods cashier shrink from being scolded by a customer ahead of me. Rather than try to cheer her up with bromides, I thanked her for bagging my stuff, slipped her a folded bill, and said: “Here, you deserve this.” She lit up while I exited to avoid awkwardness and hopefully left her with a better view of human nature.
